intro: Astragalus mattam var. macroflorus, commonly known as the large-flowered milkvetch, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its compound leaves and yellow or pale yellow flowers. The plant is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, often growing in rocky or sandy soils. Its root system is deep and fibrous, allowing it to thrive in nutrient-poor conditions. The species is of interest in ecological studies due to its role in soil stabilization and potential medicinal properties.
